height="8" width="10"><use href="#ArrowDownLightIcon"></use></svg></div></button></div><div data-selenium="miniProductPageDetailsViewClassListBtn"></div><div class="availability_UCJ1nUFwhh"><div class="stockInfoWrap_UCJ1nUFwhh"><div class="container_IGzELtkjfa default_IGzELtkjfa" data-selenium="stockInfo"><svg class="bhIcon infoIcon_IGzELtkjfa statusLow_ZC_6IRXKyD" height="12" width="12"><use href="#CheckCircleIcon"></use></svg><span class="statusLow_ZC_6IRXKyD" data-selenium="stockStatus">In Stock</span></div></div></div><div class="shippingSection_UCJ1nUFwhh"><div class="shippingInfo_UCJ1nUFwhh"><div class="messages_PfhS1OaxOq"><span><span class="shipMessageBtn_GoA0mg8hWg" data-selenium="shipMessage">Free Next Day Delivery<!-- --> <svg class="bhIcon " height="10" width="5"><use href="#RightArrowIcon"></use></svg></span></span> </div></div></div><div class="restrictiveNotes_UCJ1nUFwhh"></div><div class="otherBuyingOptions_UCJ1nUFwhh" data-selenium="miniProductPageOtherBuyingOption"></div></div></div></div></div><div data-selenium="seeItemsMessage" class="scroll_B7Lw_3UWvd"><div class="sizer_B7Lw_3UWvd"><div style="overflow:visible;height:0;width:0"></div></div></div></section></div><section class="bottomSection_OOvCaqUpUN"><div class="listingPagingContainer_Mq9n1iP4rq"><div class="spaceHolder_Mq9n1iP4rq"></div><div data-selenium="listingPagingContainer" class="paging_Mq9n1iP4rq"><ul data-selenium="listingPagingList" class="list_Mq9n1iP4rq"><li><a data-selenium="listingPagingPagePrev" class="arrowLink_Mq9n1iP4rq" href="/c/buy/Digital-Cameras/ci/9811/N/4288586282/pn/19"><svg class="bhIcon arrowLinkIcon_Mq9n1iP4rq" height="18" width="14"><use href="#ArrowLeftDarkIcon"></use></svg></a></li><li class="dots_Mq9n1iP4rq">...</li><li><a data-selenium="listingPagingLink" class="link_Mq9n1iP4rq" href="/c/buy/Digital-Cameras/ci/9811/N/4288586282/pn/16">16</a></li><li><a data-selenium="listingPagingLink" class="link_Mq9n1iP4rq" href="/c/buy/Digital-Cameras/ci/9811/N/4288586282/pn/17">17</a></li><li><a data-selenium="listingPagingLink" class="link_Mq9n1iP4rq" href="/c/buy/Digital-Cameras/ci/9811/N/4288586282/pn/18">18</a></li><li><a data-selenium="listingPagingLink" class="link_Mq9n1iP4rq" href="/c/buy/Digital-Cameras/ci/9811/N/4288586282/pn/19">19</a></li><li><a data-selenium="listingPagingLink" class="link_Mq9n1iP4rq linkActive_Mq9n1iP4rq" href="/c/buy/Digital-Cameras/ci/9811/N/4288586282/pn/20">20</a></li><li><a data-selenium="listingPagingLink" class="link_Mq9n1iP4rq" href="/c/buy/Digital-Cameras/ci/9811/N/4288586282/pn/21">21</a></li><li><a data-selenium="listingPagingLink" class="link_Mq9n1iP4rq" href="/c/buy/Digital-Cameras/ci/9811/N/4288586282/pn/22">22</a></li><li><a data-selenium="listingPagingLink" class="link_Mq9n1iP4rq" href="/c/buy/Digital-Cameras/ci/9811/N/4288586282/pn/23">23</a></li><li class="dots_Mq9n1iP4rq">...</li><li><a data-selenium="listingPagingPageNext" class="arrowLink_Mq9n1iP4rq" href="/c/buy/Digital-Cameras/ci/9811/N/4288586282/pn/21"><svg class="bhIcon arrowLinkIcon_Mq9n1iP4rq" height="18" width="14"><use href="#ArrowRightDarkIcon"></use></svg></a></li></ul><div class="flexContainer_Mq9n1iP4rq"></div></div></div><div class="lazyload-placeholder"></div><div><div class="partialExpander_POPFgXhmYy whiteGradient_POPFgXhmYy" style="max-height:auto"><div class="content_POPFgXhmYy"><div class="categoryDescription_OAknmg6eo1 categorySeo_OOvCaqUpUN js-injected-html"><h2>Digital Camera Buying Guide</h2><p>B&amp;H Photo has been a staple in the photography and videography businesses since it was founded in 1973. Though we service more industries today, cameras remain the lifeblood of our business. We sell a wide variety of digital cameras from all the top brands like Canon, Nikon, Sony, Panasonic, Fujifilm, Pentax, Leica, Samsung, and more. Digital camera types include Digital SLR cameras (DSLR), Mirrorless System cameras, Point-and-Shoot cameras, Medium Format cameras, camera bundles and more. Read below to find out which camera type best suits your needs.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><b>Types of Digital Cameras&nbsp;</b></p><p><b>DSLR (digital single-lens reflex) cameras</b> largely replaced film-based SLRs during the 2000s. DSLRs are the most advanced and versatile cameras available to consumers today. They give you the most control over how your pictures are taken, and are thus meant for more serious amateur photographers and professionals. DSLRs allow you complete control over exposure settings, including aperture priority, shutter priority, and various program modes. Their fast autofocus produces great shots when shooting fast-moving subjects or scenes. They also utilize an interchangeable lens system, enabling photographers to use the most appropriate lens for whatever they are shooting. Finally, DSLRs have large sensors, which generally produce higher-quality images. <a href="https://www.bhphotovideo.com/c/buy/SLR-Digital-Cameras/ci/6222/N/4288586280">Learn More About DSLRs</a>.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><strong>Mirrorless system cameras</strong> are very similar to DSLR cameras in that they use interchangeable lenses, have large sensors, and allow the photographer to use the camera in full manual, automatic, or semi-automatic modes. The main difference is the size. Mirrorless cameras are closer to the size of compact point-and-shoot cameras because they do not have the optical viewfinder that DSLRs have. Optical viewfinders use a system of mirrors that accurately show the scene about to be photographed. Mirrorless cameras forgo those for electronic viewfinders or LCD screens, which preview the scene about to be photographed. This makes them quieter, smaller, and lighter, which is ideal for more serious photographers who value discretion and portability, from wedding and theater photographers to travel photographers. <a href="https://www.bhphotovideo.com/c/buy/Mirrorless-System-Cameras/ci/16158/N/4288586281">Learn More About Mirrorless Cameras</a>.</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><strong>Point-and-shoot cameras</strong> (sometimes called compact cameras) are most suited for entry-level hobbyists who value their smaller size and ease of use. The mode most often used on point-and-shoots is ‘automatic,’ which is great for beginners, and will generally produce a good photo. Those who want to take it a step further can use other scene modes such as landscape, portrait, or sports, depending on the shooting situation. Most point-and-shoots today feature at least a 3x zoom and 16.6 MP, making them better than most new smartphone cameras, and great for enlarging and printing photos. For amateur photographers who want something small that can fit into a purse or pocket, a point-and-shoot is probably the best option. Learn More About Point and Shoot</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p><b>Medium format cameras</b> are reserved for serious professionals. Their large sensors allow for larger individual pixels, and for more light to enter the camera. They also allow for a much greater dynamic range, which means larger tonal value, and greater color accuracy. The end results are stunning “real world” photos which capture scenes close to how your eyes and brain process them. If your goal is to take a photograph and enlarge it considerably, then medium format cameras are your best option. Be aware, though, that they often come with a steep price.</p><ul></ul><script async="" crossorigin="anonymous" src="https://edge.fullstory.com/s/fs.js">
</script></div></div></div></div></section></div></div></div></div><footer class="footer_pSIIQCyYIg"><div class="row_mBoWhODsuD footerInner_pSIIQCyYIg"><div class="col_mBoWhODsuD col-9_mBoWhODsuD &lt;li class=\&quot;MsoListParagraph\&quot; style=\&quot;margin-left:0in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo1\&quot;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Multi-Pack:&lt;/b&gt; Multiples of the same item. &lt;/li&gt; &lt;li class=\&quot;MsoListParagraph\&quot; We carry a vast selection of Digital Cameras, Mirrorless Cameras, and Digital Camera Kits. Go to B&amp;H for the best prices on  digital cameras&quot;,&quot;metaKeyword&quot;:&quot;Shop Digital Cameras, Camera bundles, Point &amp; Shoot Cameras, Mirrorless System Cameras, DSLR Cameras, Best Digital Camera&quot;,&quot;metaContent&quot;:&quot;&lt;h2&gt;Digital Camera Buying Guide&lt;/h2&gt;&lt;p&gt;B&amp;amp;H Photo has been a staple in the photography and videography businesses since it was founded in 1973. Though we service more industries today, cameras remain the lifeblood of our business. We sell a wide variety of digital cameras from all the top brands like Canon, Nikon, Sony, Panasonic, Fujifilm, Pentax, Leica, Samsung, and more. Digital camera types include Digital SLR cameras (DSLR), Mirrorless System cameras, Point-and-Shoot cameras, Medium Format cameras, camera bundles and more. Read below to find out which camera type best suits your needs.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;b&gt;Types of Digital Cameras&amp;nbsp;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;b&gt;DSLR (digital single-lens reflex) cameras&lt;/b&gt; largely replaced film-based SLRs during the 2000s. DSLRs are the most advanced and versatile cameras available to consumers today. They give you the most control over how your pictures are taken, and are thus meant for more serious amateur photographers and professionals. DSLRs allow you complete control over exposure settings, including aperture priority, shutter priority, and various program modes. Their fast autofocus produces great shots when shooting fast-moving subjects or scenes. They also utilize an interchangeable lens system, enabling photographers to use the most appropriate lens for whatever they are shooting. Finally, DSLRs have large sensors, which generally produce higher-quality images. &lt;a href=\&quot;https://www.bhphotovideo.com/c/buy/SLR-Digital-Cameras/ci/6222/N/4288586280\&quot;&gt;Learn More About DSLRs&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Mirrorless system cameras&lt;/strong&gt; are very similar to DSLR cameras in that they use interchangeable lenses, have large sensors, and allow the photographer to use the camera in full manual, automatic, or semi-automatic modes. The main difference is the size. Mirrorless cameras are closer to the size of compact point-and-shoot cameras because they do not have the optical viewfinder that DSLRs have. Optical viewfinders use a system of mirrors that accurately show the scene about to be photographed. Mirrorless cameras forgo those for electronic viewfinders or LCD screens, which preview the scene about to be photographed. This makes them quieter, smaller, and lighter, which is ideal for more serious photographers who value discretion and portability, from wedding and theater photographers to travel photographers. &lt;a href=\&quot;https://www.bhphotovideo.com/c/buy/Mirrorless-System-Cameras/ci/16158/N/4288586281\&quot;&gt;Learn More About Mirrorless Cameras&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Point-and-shoot cameras&lt;/strong&gt; (sometimes called compact cameras) are most suited for entry-level hobbyists who value their smaller size and ease of use. The mode most often used on point-and-shoots is &amp;lsquo;automatic,&amp;rsquo; which is great for beginners, and will generally produce a good photo. Those who want to take it a step further can use other scene modes such as landscape, portrait, or sports, depending on the shooting situation. Most point-and-shoots today feature at least a 3x zoom and 16.6 MP, making them better than most new smartphone cameras, and great for enlarging and printing photos. For amateur photographers who want something small that can fit into a purse or pocket, a point-and-shoot is probably the best option. Learn More About Point and Shoot&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;p&gt;&lt;b&gt;Medium format cameras&lt;/b&gt; are reserved for serious professionals. Their large sensors allow for larger individual pixels, and for more light to enter the camera. They also allow for a much greater dynamic range, which means larger tonal value, and greater color accuracy. The end results are stunning &amp;ldquo;real world&amp;rdquo; photos which capture scenes close to how your eyes and brain process them. If your goal is to take a photograph and enlarge it considerably, then medium format cameras are your best option. Be aware, though, that they often come with a steep price.&lt;/p&gt;&lt;ul&gt;&lt;/ul&gt;&lt;script async=\&quot;\&quot; crossorigin=\&quot;anonymous\&quot; 	var appendScript = function(url, cb) {
		var h = document.getElementsByTagName("head")[0],
			d = false,
			s = document.createElement("script");
		s.src = url;
		s.onload = s.onreadystatechange = function() {
			if (!d && (!this.readyState || this.readyState == "loaded" || this.readyState == "complete")) {
				d = true;
				if (typeof cb === "function") {
					cb();
				}
			}
		};
		h.appendChild(s);
	};
	var onLoad = function(cb) {
		if (document.readyState == "complete") {
			cb();
		} else {
			if (window.addEventListener) window.addEventListener("load", cb, false);
			else window.attachEvent("onload", cb);
		}
	};
	var loader = {
		lazyJs: function(url, cb) {
			onLoad(function() {
				appendScript(url, cb);
			});
		},
		lazyRunJs: function(func) {
			onLoad(func);
		},
	};
	window.loader = loader;
